item.title: Honkai Star Rail 3.4 Livestream Redeem Codes (June 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Honkai: Star Rail 3.4 Livestream Redeem Codes (June 2025)
  • How To Redeem Honkai: Star Rail Codes
  • Stellar Jade In Honkai: Star Rail

Similar to Genshin Impact, which often has some codes, Honkai: Star Rail also features some redeem codes for people to claim on launch day. This article will feature HSR redeem codes , how to redeem them, and other items players will get for their Trailblazing journey.

Updated on June 20, 2025, by Nahda Nabiilah : Honkai: Star Rail 3.4 is likely one of the biggest updates for HSR, since it brings some of the most anticipated characters. First, players will be able to use Phainon in combat, and on top of that, two collab characters, Saber and Archer from Fate/Stay Night, will also be available. Version 3.4 also buffs some of the beloved old characters, like a few members of the Stellaron Hunters. Trailblazers who are looking forward to the plethora of improvements in the next version can celebrate the upcoming update by claiming the following HSR 3.4 livestream codes .

Honkai: Star Rail 3.4 Livestream Redeem Codes (June 2025)

Make sure to claim these HSR 3.4 livestream codes as they expire quickly:

  • FTJ6CVTULSXP (100 Stellar Jades + 50k Credit)
  • ZS36CVBUMTZB (100 Stellar Jades + 5 Traveler's Guide)
  • [TBA] (100 Stellar Jades + 4 Refined Aether)

Additionally, here are all the HSR redeem codes for June 2025:

  • 7B36DCTC5SZ7 (50 Stellar Jades + 10k Credit)
  • CIPHERLOOT
  • FAREWELL (60 Stellar Jades + 1 Fuel)
  • IFYOUAREREADINGTHIS (60 Stellar Jades + 1 Fuel)
  • STARRAILGIFT (50 Stellar Jades)

How To Redeem Honkai: Star Rail Codes

To redeem the HSR codes, log in to the Honkai: Star Rail redeem code website https://hsr.hoyoverse.com/gift, then manually input the codes, or simply press on the link to open the redemption site with the code automatically attached to it .

Players should ensure they have already made an account before trying to redeem. Otherwise, the website won't find the desired profile.

Alternatively, once players unlock the in-game menu, there will be a Redemption Code button under Trailblazer Profile , which can be accessed by pressing the menu button next to their MC's name.

Stellar Jade In Honkai: Star Rail

Stellar Jade is the primary currency for Honkai: Star Rail players. In Genshin Impact , it’s equivalent to Primogems, which means people will use it for gacha (called Warp in HSR) and to recover 60 Trailblaze Power, up to eight times per day. Just like in Genshin Impact , each Warp will cost 160 Stellar Jades, and there are two types of Warping currencies; Star Rail Pass and Star Rail Special Pass . The former is used for Standard Warp, while the latter is for Limited Banner, which includes Honkai: Star Rail Seele.

The game features a Beginner Banner for new players, which allows people to gain 50 Warp at the cost of 40. A guaranteed 5-star will also be rewarded after all 40 pulls are performed.

item.title: Which Music Type Should You Choose in The Alters?
item.description:
In Journey II of The Alters , you will have one decision you need to make with your alters. As the base moves forward, the alters gather in the kitchen area, arguing once again. They will require you to make the final choice.

This choice is all about what playlist to choose. Each of the alters has a different type of music in mind, and they are at each other's throats trying to get themselves heard. There are four total choices you can make; one for each alter type you in The Alters .

How to Choose a Type of Music in The Alters

After you have completed Act I of The Alters , you will get a choice of some music. The types of music that are called out at this point in the game will vary depending on which alters you have made. For example, the technician, which is the required alter, will want rock 'n' roll, the scientist will want no celebration and no music, the miner will want grunge, the botanist will call for something calm and soothing, the refiner alter will say something about throwing a rave, etc.

It appears that regardless of the types of alters you have picked first in The Alters , you will get the same four choices: rave music, rock 'n' roll, chill and calm, or saying that you don't think everyone should be celebrating just yet.

No matter which one of these you choose, the outcome will be the same: you will get a fun music scene with your chosen alters. None of the choices will lower or raise the alters' happiness levels. So feel free to choose whatever music you like.

What Lyrics Can You Sing In Journey II?

After you choose, you will get one of the funniest cutscenes of the entire game: an entire song sung by all the different alters together, and you get to pick some of the lyrics. There are two branching options, and the lyrics that the main Jan sings will be different based on what you choose. These are the dialogue options in The Alters Journey II's song.

  • "The road ahead of us."
    • "I'm ready for its twists and turns."
      • "I know I'm in it with my friends."
      • "And now the future makes more sense."

    • "I simply don't know where it ends."
      • "I know I'm in it with my friends."
      • "And now the future makes more sense."

  • "The path we've travelled together."
    • "I've been roaming with no guiding light."
      • "Together we can win this fight."
      • "We've got a common goal in sight."

    • "I've made choices that were not always right."
      • "Together we can win this fight."
      • "We've got a common goal in sight."

item.title: Roblox: Jailbird Codes (June 2025)
item.description:
Jailbird is an exciting Roblox game that allows you to participate in multiplayer matches. There are lots of different guns that you can use to shoot your enemies at any distance. Also, Jailbird has various promo codes that you can use to get some free bonuses. Here, we will tell you about these Jailbird codes and explain to you how to redeem them.

Updated June 20, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Jailbird has introduced several new codes packed with useful rewards to give your gameplay a solid boost. You can grab thousands in Cash, along with Credits, Co-Points, and valuable boosters to help you level up faster. Keep an eye out for more additions as the game continues to roll out fresh content.

All Jailbird Codes

Working Jailbird Codes

  • SKIRMISHUPDATE – Gives you 1,500 Cash. (NEW)
  • 60KLIKESJAILBIRD – Gives you Cash, Credits and Co-Points. (NEW)
  • QOLUPDATE – Gives you 1,500 Cash. (NEW)
  • GRINDINGTIME – Gives you a Cash Booster. (NEW)
  • BOOSTED – Gives you Cash and a Cash Booster. (NEW)
  • 50KLIKESJAILBIRD – Gives you Cash, Credits and Co-Points.
  • CHIVVEDYT – Gives you a Chivvedyt Skins.
  • MADDERSYT – Gives you a Maddersyt Skins.
  • JAILBIRD2025 – Gives you an EXP Booster and 2500 Cash.
  • MADDERS – Gives you a Regular Crate and a Cash Booster.
  • JAILBIRDSTARTER – Gives you an EXP Booster.
  • JAILBIRD – Gives you 500 Cash.
  • REMASTERED – Gives you 1,000 Cash.

Expired Jailbird Codes

  • S4RELEASE
  • S3RELEASE
  • 50KLIKESJAILBIRD
  • MAJORUPDATEMAY
  • SEASON2YAY
  • 30KLIKESJAILBIRD
  • 10KLIKESJAILBIRD
  • 35KLIKESJAILBIRD
  • 15MILJAILBIRD
  • THANKSFORWAITING
  • Season2Release
  • 100KFAVJAILBIRD
  • 10MILJAILBIRD
  • 25KLIKES
  • 20KLIKESJAILBIRDYAY
  • 7MILJAILBIRD
  • 20KLIKES
  • 1MILJAILBIRD
  • 70KFAVOURITES
  • 6MILJAILBIRD
  • 5MILJAILBIRD
  • 15KLIKES
  • BETAJAILBIRD

If you want to get more weapons in Jailbird , you will need to farm Cash. With this currency, you can purchase lots of new items that you can use to create the best loadout for your character. So, you should definitely redeem all promo codes that allow you to get some free Cash as they will help you buy the things you need.

Also, there are various boosters that you can get by redeeming some of these codes. They are very useful and help you progress faster in Jailbird .

How to Redeem Jailbird Codes

In order to get your Cash, Credits, and Boosters, you will need to learn how to redeem Jailbird codes. This process is simple, and you can perform it the same way as in other Roblox experiences. Follow the steps below to use promo codes and claim your rewards:

  • Launch Jailbird . Wait for the game to load.
  • After that, look at the top left corner of your game screen. There, you will find a button that says “Promocode”.
  • Click on the Promocode button and a menu will pop up.
  • Enter the code you want to redeem.
  • Click on the Claim button. The reward is yours.

How to Get New Jailbird Codes

The developers of Jailbird can create new Roblox promo codes and if this happens, we will add them to this guide. So, you can bookmark it and check it for updates from time to time. Also, you can follow the official media related to Jailbird :

  • X Account
  • Roblox Group
  • Discord Server

item.title: Schedule 1 Dev Provides Update on Australia Relisting
item.description:
Schedule 1 developer TVGS has provided players with an update surrounding the game's classification rating in Australia, with hopes that it will be relisted by the end of July. Schedule 1 blew up on Steam earlier this month, becoming one of the most played games on the platform. But fans who were looking to get in on the action were left disappointed when the smash hit indie game suddenly vanished from the storefront in Australia. Thankfully, it doesn't look like it will be gone for much longer.

After a monumental early access release in March, peaking at almost 460,000 concurrent players, Schedule 1 had cemented itself as one of the biggest indie game releases of the year. However, its release hasn't been without a few issues, one of which was Schedule 1 's sudden removal from Steam in Australia. On May 12, fans of the indie game took to social media to question why Schedule 1 was no longer available for purchase within the country. While many believed the title had been banned due to its illicit themes, TVGS quickly responded by stating that this was not the case, and that Schedule 1 simply needed an age classification before it could be relisted.

Schedule 1 May Be Relisted in Australia Soon

With it now being well over a month since the game's removal in Australia, fans are eager to know when it may return. According to Tyler, the sole developer of Schedule 1 , the classification process is still ongoing. In a recent developer livestream, Tyler reiterated that the game had not been banned in Australia and was simply unavailable while it goes through an age rating process with the Australian Classification Board. The drug-related themes of Schedule 1 appear to be making the process a little longer than usual, but Tyler remains confident that Schedule 1 will receive an 18+ rating in Australia and will then return to Steam. As for when that may be, Tyler is apparently close to submitting the application, which will then take up to 25 working days to be processed. If all goes well, Schedule 1 should be back on Steam in Australia by the end of July.

While it looks like Schedule 1 may soon return to Steam in Australia, it hasn't been the only headache for developer TVGS. Shortly after the game's release earlier this year, Drug Deal Simulator publisher Movie Games S.A. announced it was investigating Schedule 1 for potential copyright infringement. Nothing seems to have come from the accusations as of yet, but the publisher claimed that Schedule 1 may have taken various elements from Drug Deal Simulator , such as plot, gameplay mechanics, and user interface. Fans of Schedule 1 were quick to bash Movie Games S.A. and even review-bombed Drug Deal Simulator on Steam because of the accusations.

Thankfully, these issues don't appear to have prevented Tyler from continuing to update the game with plenty of new features, bug fixes, and quality-of-life improvements. While multiple content updates have already been released, Tyler recently allowed fans to vote on the next major Schedule 1 update. Voting has since closed, but players had the opportunity to choose between a Rival Cartel update, a Shrooms update, or a Police Expansions update. But with over 440,000 submissions and 64% of votes, the Rival Cartel update came out on top and is now aiming for a release in late July.

item.title: 8 Best Reputation Systems In Open-World Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Reputation systems in open-world games reflect player choices, impacting gameplay and interactions with NPCs.
  • Games like RDR2, Skyrim, and ELEX showcase diverse reputation mechanics with consequences on story and gameplay.
  • Systems in games like Dying Light 2 and Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 allow players to shape the game world based on their faction alignments and actions.

In the vast universes of open-world games, reputation systems are more than just numbers on a meter. Think of these mechanics as the “social credit score” of gaming, where every deed, good or bad, echoes across cities, factions, and entire worlds. These systems turn everyday choices into ripple effects, making every playthrough feel unique and personal.

One minute, a heroic act could earn discounts and adoration from townsfolk; the next, a single crime might brand players as an outlaw in the eyes of an entire community. What sets the best open-world reputation systems apart isn’t just complexity, but how seamlessly they blend into gameplay, reacting to every decision, shifting the story, and making the world feel truly alive.

8 Red Dead Redemption 2

Moral Crossroads In The Old West

Red Dead Redemption 2

Red Dead Redemption 2 ’s Honor System is the heart of Rockstar’s Western epic, making every gunfight and act of kindness feel consequential. The system tracks Arthur Morgan’s moral path on a single scale, rewarding honorable deeds with discounts, special gear, and even a shot at redemption in the game’s closing moments.

Help a stranger in trouble, and that same NPC might later save Arthur’s life or hand over a free weapon at the local shop. The Honor meter shapes not just the story’s tone, but also how the world responds to Arthur. At high honor, players are met with friendly greetings and admiration. At low honor, hostility and suspicion become the norm. The most visible differences come in loot drops, shop discounts, and alternative narrative outcomes, including distinct endings based on Arthur’s path.

7 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Localized Reputation In The Land Of Dragons

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Publisher(s)
Bethesda Softworks
Powered by

Skyrim ’s approach to reputation is built around a patchwork of hold-specific bounties, faction standings, and local titles like Thane. Commit crimes in Whiterun, and the guards there will hunt players down—but travel to Solitude, and the player is greeted as a hero, their criminal past forgotten at the border.

Join the Thieves Guild or Dark Brotherhood, and players gain status within those groups, unlocking unique quests and rewards. There’s no overarching fame or infamy that reshapes the entire province’s perception. That said, the bounty and faction systems create localized tension, with guards, merchants, and citizens reacting dynamically to players’ choices, at least within their home turf.

6 ELEX

Cold Logic And Faction Ties In Dual Reputation System

M For Mature 17+ // Blood, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)

ELEX introduces a unique blend of science-fantasy and social mechanics, giving players a world where allegiances and personal evolution both matter. Players align with one of three main factions. Berserkers, Clerics, or Outlaws—each unlocking exclusive quests, abilities, and gear. But ELEX takes it further with its “Cold” system, a morality slider measuring Jax’s emotional state from compassionate to ruthlessly logical.

Choices influence both faction reputation and the Cold score, affecting not just the ending but moment-to-moment gameplay. This dual system rewards replayability, letting the fans explore radically different versions of the protagonist and the world’s response.

Dying Light 2 ’s City Alignment system puts the fate of Villedor’s districts in players’ hands. Each time a water tower or electrical station is liberated, players must choose: hand it to the combat-focused Peacekeepers or the community-focused Survivors. The decision immediately transforms the city.

Peacekeeper zones come with traps and firepower, while Survivor territory is all about ziplines and acrobatic freedom. Unlike more traditional reputation meters, City Alignment offers tangible, visible changes: new gear, shortcuts, and traversal options tailored to player preference. These choices don’t just affect the world’s appearance; they also fundamentally shift gameplay style, letting players shape the urban playground to match any approach they like.

Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment

Obsidian’s The Outer Worlds takes "reputation" to new heights with its intricate web of competing corporations, rebels, and settlements. Every major group in the Halcyon system has its own independent Fame and Infamy meters, and actions, good or bad, leave lasting marks. Rescue a settlement, and vendors shower players with discounts. Double-cross a faction, and they might put a price on the protagonist’s head, turning entire planets hostile.

What makes The Outer Worlds shine is the game’s nuance. It’s possible to be both admired and resented by the same group, unlocking unique dialogue, prices, or even attacks on sight. Questlines can branch, close off, or even turn lethal depending on reputation, and the final battles can play out very differently based on which alliances have been forged.

3 Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Every Action Counts In Medieval Bohemia

Publisher(s)
Deep Silver

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 brings reputation down to earth, literally. Set in medieval Bohemia, the system tracks standing not just by town, but by individual social groups: merchants, guards, commoners, and even specific NPCs. Help villagers or solve crimes, and the player’s reputation rises, unlocking better prices, new quests, and community trust.

But if players are caught stealing or show up filthy after a brawl, then the whole town might shun or overcharge the player. A good enough reputation might mean guards overlook minor offenses, whereas a notorious thief will face harsh punishments or even random shakedowns. Reputation can spread from one village to another, and everything from trading etiquette to moral decisions shapes the journey.

2 Fallout: New Vegas

Forging Alliances In The Mojave Wasteland

Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment

Few reputation systems are as ruthless as Fallout: New Vegas . Set in the Mojave Wasteland, it tracks positive and negative standings with a huge range of factions: the NCR, Caesar’s Legion, Boomers, Brotherhood of Steel, and more. Every choice, whether it’s helping a small town or siding with a power-hungry warlord, affects the balance of power, questlines, and even random encounters across the desert.

The system’s brilliance lies in its complexity. Fame and Infamy are tracked independently, letting players be both respected and feared, depending on their actions. Faction alliances open up or close off missions, change how towns and territories react, and determine whether players are welcomed with open arms or attacked on sight. This deep integration makes Fallout: New Vegas immensely replayable, as each attempt to control Hoover Dam can unfold through a radically different lens.

1 Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord

Lordship And Legacy In Calradia’s Dynamic World

Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord
8.0 /10

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
TaleWorlds Entertainment
Powered by

Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord arguably takes the crown for the most intricate and deeply integrated reputation system. Gamers can forge alliances, declare feuds, negotiate marriages, or even carve out entire kingdoms. Every victory, defeat, or diplomatic move shapes not just personal reputation but the shifting allegiances and wars of the whole continent.

NPCs weigh past actions in every negotiation or battlefield standoff, and earning trust (or infamy) can turn tides in both politics and war. The game is a true testament to how social standing can make or break an epic adventure. The world feels alive, reactive, unpredictable, and rich with opportunity for both peace and chaos. That’s why it’s the gold standard for player-driven reputation in open-world games.
